TopicTitle: just upgraded to the full version

Articles.Content:
been playing the demo for a couple weeks and decided to get it after watching some youtube videos. I was pretty surprised to discover that things are quite a bit more fragile in the full version than they are in the demo. So many components to get used to.

is there a way to get tooltips on components you've already pulled out into the bay, or do I have to try to guess which item in the list is the one I have out there?
The second one. You'll get used to it, each piece is visually distinct.

Many of the stock items in the demo are the smaller sized in the current version. So, any ships that you built in the demo can also be built in the 0.2101 game. What is different is that larger tanks, engines, and command units are available. You can launch probes instead of risk Kerbals. You can play with aircraft.

One major difference is the way SAS controllers operate. The ones built into command modules will be more then adequate for stabilizing your rockets in flight and if you have wobbling now when flying, it is because your rocket needs more bracing to stabilize it. Also, using SAS requires power so you will need solar panels or thermal generators when your engines are not firing.
